com.communote.server.core.mail

Class MailMessageHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.communote.server.core.mail.MailMessageHelper

  • public final class MailMessageHelper
extends Object
    Helper class for mail messages
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String ANONYMOUS_EMAIL_ADDRESS_SUFFIX
      Suffix of an email address (starting with @) of an anonymized user.

      • ANONYMOUS_EMAIL_ADDRESS_SUFFIX

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • assertNonAnonymousRecipients

        public static void assertNonAnonymousRecipients(javax.mail.Message message)
                                         throws javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                                InvalidRecipientMailAddressException
        Verifies that no email address in TO, BCC and CC headers ends with ANONYMOUS_EMAIL_ADDRESS_SUFFIX. In case such an email address is encountered an InvalidRecipientMailAddressException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to check
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - in case the message has no recipients or getting the recipients failed
        InvalidRecipientMailAddressException - in case an anonymous recipient is encountered

      • createMessageIdHeaderValue

        public static String createMessageIdHeaderValue(String identifier)
        Creates a value for the Message-ID header.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier to convert to the header value. The identifier must be in dot-atom-text format as defined in RFC 2822
        Returns:
        the header value

      • extractMessageIdentifierFromReplyHeaders

        public static String extractMessageIdentifierFromReplyHeaders(javax.mail.Message message)
                                                       throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Extracts the message identifier from the reply headers. The returned value is the identifier passed to createMessageIdHeaderValue(String).
        Parameters:
        message - the message to evaluate
        Returns:
        the identifier or null if none of the reply headers is set or the found value does not adhere to the msg-id format specification of RFC 822
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - in case of an error while reading the email headers

      • extractMessagePartsMatchingMimeTypes

        public static Map<String,javax.mail.Part> extractMessagePartsMatchingMimeTypes(javax.mail.Message message,
                                                                               String... mimeTypes)
                                                                        throws javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                                                               IOException
        Extracts all parts (especially in case of a multipart message) of a message that have one of the supplied MIME types.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to process
        mimeTypes - the MIME types to search for
        Returns:
        a possibly empty mapping from MIME type to message part
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - in case of an error while reading the email data
        IOException - if accessing the content of the part failed

      • filterAnonymousUsers

        public static Collection<User> filterAnonymousUsers(Collection<User> receivers)
        Parameters:
        receivers -
        Returns:
        all users which do not have an anonymous email

      • getAllRecipients

        public static String[] getAllRecipients(javax.mail.Message message)
                                 throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Shorthand for calling getAllRecipients(Message, boolean, boolean, String) with arguments message, true, true, null
        Parameters:
        message - the message to check
        Returns:
        the addresses found or null if there were no
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - in case of an error while reading the recipients

      • getAllRecipients

        public static String[] getAllRecipients(javax.mail.Message message,
                                        boolean evaluateBoth,
                                        boolean startWithStandardHeaders,
                                        String suffixFilter)
                                 throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Gets all recipients found in X-Original-To header field and/or the standard recipient headers (TO,CC,Delivered-To - where the latter is useful for emails received because of a Bcc header).
        Parameters:
        message - the message to check
        evaluateBoth - whether to check both header types. If false the other header type will only be evaluated if the first header type was empty.
        startWithStandardHeaders - when true the TO/CC/BCC headers will be evaluated first, otherwise the X-Original-To header
        suffixFilter - optional filter to restrict results to email addresses that end with the suffix. If null all values will be accepted.
        Returns:
        the addresses found or null if there were no
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - in case of an error while reading the recipients

      • getAttachments

        public static Collection<AttachmentTO> getAttachments(javax.mail.Message message)
                                               throws javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                                      IOException
        Extracts the attachments from the mail.
        Parameters:
        message - The message.
        Returns:
        Collection of attachments as AttachmentTO.
        Throws:
        IOException - Exception.
        javax.mail.MessagingException - Exception.

      • getMessageText

        public static String getMessageText(javax.mail.Message message,
                                    boolean plainTextOnly,
                                    boolean cleanup)
                             throws javax.mail.MessagingException,
                                    IOException
        Returns the text content of a email message.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to process
        plainTextOnly - when false this method will first look for an HTML message part and return it. If there is no such part a plain text part is searched and returned. In case this parameter is true this method will first search for a plain text message part and return it. If none exists a HTML message part is searched and cleaned from HTML markup before it is returned.
        cleanup - if true some cleanup operations will be done before returning. This only applies when returning HTML from an HTML part or plain text from a HTML part (here the cleanup will replace paragraphs with newlines).
        Returns:
        the text part or null if there is no plain text or HTML part
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - in case of an error while reading the email data
        IOException - if accessing the content of the part failed

      • getRecipients

        public static String[] getRecipients(javax.mail.Message message,
                                     javax.mail.Message.RecipientType recipientType)
                              throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Returns the recipients found by evaluating the provided header.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to check
        recipientType - the recipient header to evaluate
        Returns:
        the found recipients
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - in case of an error while reading the recipients

      • isAnonymousEmailAddress

        public static boolean isAnonymousEmailAddress(String email)
        Parameters:
        email - true if it is an anonymous email and hence no mail should be send here
        Returns:

      • isOutlookMessage

        public static boolean isOutlookMessage(javax.mail.Message message)
                                throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Tries to determine whether a message was created using a MS Outlook Mail-Client. This is done by inspecting the X-Mailer and the X-MimeOLE header.
        Parameters:
        message - the message to check
        Returns:
        whether the message was created using MS Outlook
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException - in case of an error while reading the email data

      • sendMessage

        public static void sendMessage(Collection<User> receivers,
                               String template,
                               Map<String,Object> model)
        Sends a mail message to the defined receivers with the correct locale.
        Parameters:
        receivers - List of receivers.
        template - The template.
        model - The model.

      • sendMessage

        public static void sendMessage(Collection<User> receivers,
                               String messageKey,
                               Map<String,Object> model,
                               String replyToAddress,
                               String replyToName)
        Sends a mail message to the defined receivers with the correct locale.
        Parameters:
        receivers - List of receivers.
        messageKey - The message key of the template.
        model - The model.
        replyToAddress - Address for reply to (optional).
        replyToName - Name for reply to (optional).
